title: Justiciar armour

properties.name: description
properties.value: Justiciar armour is a set of armour requiring 75 Defence to equip. The armour belonged to the Saradominist Justiciars, an elite group of warriors active during the God Wars and most notably in the defence of Hallowvale against the vampyre forces of Lord Drakan. After their defeat, their armour was claimed as trophies by the vampyres and came into the possession of Verzik Vitur. The set can only be obtained as rare drops from the Theatre of Blood.

content:
Justiciar armour is a set of armour requiring 75 Defence to equip. The armour belonged to the Saradominist Justiciars, an elite group of warriors active during the God Wars and most notably in the defence of Hallowvale against the vampyre forces of Lord Drakan. After their defeat, their armour was claimed as trophies by the vampyres and came into the possession of Verzik Vitur. The set can only be obtained as rare drops from the Theatre of Blood.

It is the best armour in RuneScape to provide Melee and Ranged defence bonuses, far surpassing Torag's armour as well as having a damage-reducing set effect. The justiciar armour also provides a significant amount of Prayer bonus, although it also penalizes both magic and ranged attack bonuses more than any other melee armour.

When the full set of Justiciar armour is equipped, the player gains a set effect that reduces all combat damage outside of PvP and typeless damage. The exact formula for the amount of damage reduced is b o n u s 3000 {\displaystyle {\frac {bonus}{3000}}} , where bonus is the player's defence bonus for that particular style. If the enemy was using a crush-based attack and the player has a crush defence bonus of +450, then 15% of the damage (450/3,000) is reduced. The set effect always reduces incoming damage by a minimum of 1. The set effect stacks with the elysian spirit shield's passive effect as well. The full set is extremely popular and useful at places where a designated tank is needed against monsters using melee and/or ranged with minimal risk from magic if the fight possesses any.

The armour can be stored in the armour case of a player-owned house costume room.

The set pieces count as Saradominist items in both the normal and Wilderness God Wars Dungeons.

Gallery[edit | edit source]

  • The initial design for the armour set, based on an aged version of Justiciar Zachariah's armour

  • A work-in-progress for an improved appearance after feedback concerning the first version

  • Three proposed models of the armour set

  • The final two models proposed in the Justiciar armour poll.

  • Design A on an armour stand within the Theatre of Blood

  • Final design on an armour stand within the Theatre of Blood

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Design A from the design poll can be seen within Verzik Vitur's throne room within the Theatre of Blood.
  • Despite being metallic, the armour is compatible with Ava's devices.
  • The Justiciar design resembles the helms of the Seven Priestly Warriors, as seen in the Varrock museum. However, the Seven Priestly Warriors fought during the year 1200 of the Fourth Age, and based on the account of the turncloak, it is doubtful that the Justiciar order survived the God Wars.
  • Based on the statues found in the Hallowed Sepulchre and the dialogue and appearance of the ghostly knights encountered in its lobby, the Justiciar set of armour obtainable from the Theatre of Blood appears to be the armour of the Justiciar of the Wolf, who died long before the vampyre conflict reached Hallowvale. This would imply that Lady Verzik looted the tomb of the already dead Justiciar.
  • The Inquisitor's armour belonged to Phosani, formerly the Justiciar of the Wolf; the difference in appearance between the armours is due to her change in allegiance in favour of Zamorak.
  • According to some dialogue with Vanescula Drakan during Sins of the Father, it is revealed that Lady Verzik and Ranis Drakan tortured one of Queen Efaritay's Justiciars for information that would lead to a successful kidnapping of King Ascertes. After getting the information they needed, they killed the Justiciar, and it is likely that Lady Verzik kept the armour as a trophy, which could offer a canon explanation as to how she acquired the two sets of Justiciar armour present in her treasure room. Since the Design A armour described and pictured above is not depicted on any of the statues of the four known Justiciars, it is possible that more than four Justiciars exist or once existed.

rawContent:
[[File:Justiciar armour equipped.png|right|130px]]
Justiciar armour is a set of armour requiring 75 [[Defence]] to equip. The armour belonged to the [[Saradomin]]ist [[Justiciar]]s, an elite group of warriors active during the God Wars and most notably in the defence of Hallowvale against the vampyre forces of Lord Drakan. After their defeat, their armour was claimed as trophies by the vampyres and came into the possession of Verzik Vitur. The set can only be obtained as rare drops from the [[Theatre of Blood]]. 

It is the best armour in ''RuneScape'' to provide [[Melee]] and [[Ranged]] defence bonuses, far surpassing [[Torag the Corrupted's equipment|Torag's armour]] as well as having a damage-reducing [[passive effect|set effect]]. The justiciar armour also provides a significant amount of [[Prayer]] bonus, although it also penalizes both magic and ranged attack bonuses more than any other melee armour.

When the full set of Justiciar armour is equipped, the player gains a [[passive effect|set effect]] that reduces all combat damage outside of [[Player killing|PvP]] and typeless damage. The exact formula for the amount of damage reduced is <math>\frac{bonus}{3000}</math>, where bonus is the player's defence bonus for that particular style. If the enemy was using a crush-based attack and the player has a crush defence bonus of +450, then 15% of the damage (450/3,000) is reduced. The set effect always reduces incoming damage by a minimum of 1. The set effect stacks with the [[elysian spirit shield]]'s passive effect as well. The full set is extremely popular and useful at places where a designated tank is needed against monsters using melee and/or ranged with minimal risk from magic if the fight possesses any.

The armour can be stored in the [[armour case]] of a [[player-owned house]] [[costume room]].

The set pieces count as [[Saradomin]]ist items in both the [[God Wars Dungeon|normal]] and [[Wilderness God Wars Dungeon]]s.

Justiciar armour (a).png|Design A on an [[Justiciar armour (Theatre of Blood)|armour stand]] within the [[Theatre of Blood]]
Justiciar armour (b).png|Final design on an [[Justiciar armour (Theatre of Blood)|armour stand]] within the [[Theatre of Blood]]
</gallery>

==Trivia==
*Design A from the design poll can be seen within [[Verzik Vitur]]'s throne room within the [[Theatre of Blood]].
*Despite being metallic, the armour is compatible with Ava's devices.
*The Justiciar design resembles the helms of the Seven Priestly Warriors, as seen in the [[Varrock Museum#/media/File:Varrock Museum display 23.png|Varrock museum]]. However, the Seven Priestly Warriors fought during the year 1200 of the Fourth Age, and based on the account of [[the turncloak]], it is doubtful that the Justiciar order survived the God Wars.
*Based on the statues found in the [[Hallowed Sepulchre]] and the [[Knight of the Wolf|dialogue]] and appearance of the ghostly knights encountered in its lobby, the Justiciar set of armour obtainable from the Theatre of Blood appears to be the armour of the Justiciar of the Wolf, who died long before the vampyre conflict reached Hallowvale. This would imply that Lady Verzik looted the tomb of the already dead Justiciar.
*The [[Inquisitor's armour]] belonged to [[Phosani]], formerly the Justiciar of the Wolf; the difference in appearance between the armours is due to her change in allegiance in favour of Zamorak.
* According to some dialogue with [[Vanescula Drakan]] during [[Sins of the Father]], it is revealed that Lady Verzik and Ranis Drakan tortured one of [[Queen Efaritay]]'s Justiciars for information that would lead to a successful kidnapping of [[King Ascertes]]. After getting the information they needed, they killed the Justiciar, and it is likely that Lady Verzik kept the armour as a trophy, which could offer a canon explanation as to how she acquired the two sets of Justiciar armour present in her treasure room. Since the Design A armour described and pictured above is not depicted on any of the statues of the four known Justiciars, it is possible that more than four Justiciars exist or once existed.
